words.def: Angles - the lines of vision of people sitting at certain position in the audience which enable a secret to be spotted* usually extreme left or right or behind. If a trick is "angly" it can only be done with limited audience viewpoints.
words.name: Angles

words.def: Back Palm - to palm in the back of the hand.
words.name: Back Palm

words.def: Bevel - to slide the top portion of a deck of cards back so that the back of the deck is at an angle, used in some card tricks.
words.name: Bevel

words.def: Bicycle Deck - Bicycle Playing Cards.
words.name: Bicycle Deck

words.def: Black art - the use of a stage fitted with a black velvet curtain background, using assistants and other props that are hidden by black shrouds. Careful lighting helps keep the secret a mystery to the audience.[1]
words.name: Black art

words.def: Blind Shuffle/Blind Cut - A cut or apparent shuffle in which the cards appear mixed but all of the cards are left completely undisturbed after the shuffle or cut.
words.name: Blind Shuffle/Blind Cut

words.def: Burn - a subject staring at the magician's hands without averting the gaze, no matter what Misdirection is thrown at a subject.
words.name: Burn

words.def: C/S - see Copper and Silver.
words.name: C/S

words.def: Cardician - a magician who only performs card magic (term coined by Ed Marlo).
words.name: Cardician

words.def: Cardini Single Production - a technique,invented by Cardini,that is used in card manipulation.
words.name: Cardini Single Production

words.def: Centre tear - a special way of tearing up paper billets used in mentalism.
words.name: Centre tear

words.def: Change - changing one card (or object) for another.
words.name: Change

words.def: Charlier Cut - One handed flourish cut or pass.
words.name: Charlier Cut

words.def: Classic force - a force performed by fanning the cards and timing the force card to land under their fingers.
words.name: Classic force

words.def: Classic palm - to palm with the centre of the hand.
words.name: Classic palm

words.def: Clean - a hand which is empty or the condition achieved at the end of an effect where the magician has no supposedly vanished objects or gimmicked items in her hands. See Dirty.
words.name: Clean

words.def: Cold - A deck secretly switched in during play. "Cold" because it hasn't been warmed up by handling.
words.name: Cold

words.def: Colour Change - Changing the colour of an object (e.g. Changing one card into another right in front of the spectator's eyes, as opposed to switching two cards secretly).
words.name: Colour Change

words.def: Confederate - an audience member planted to act in a cooperative manner.
words.name: Confederate

words.def: Cooler - a card deck brought into play, normally at the end of a slight of hand routine. The term is implying that you are swapping out a 'hot' deck (where the order of cards has been lost due to the act) with a pre-arranged (cooler) deck for your finale.
words.name: Cooler

words.def: Copper and Silver (also C/S) - Effect using two coins of contrasting metals which change place.
words.name: Copper and Silver

words.def: Crimp - a gambler's move which can be used in magic, there are many different types* used for card location.
words.name: Crimp

words.def: Cut and Restored - see Torn and Restored.
words.name: Cut and Restored

words.def: Deal - to take cards off the top of the deck. Dealing "seconds", "middles", or "bottoms", refers to a sleight in which the second, middle, or bottom card is secretly dealt in lieu of the top card.
words.name: Deal

words.def: Dirty - a hand which contains an object the audience should not know about, or the condition at some point where the magician has "vanished" objects or gimmicked items hidden in her hands. See Clean.
words.name: Dirty

words.def: Ditch - to secretly get rid of an object or gimmick.
words.name: Ditch

words.def: Dove pan - a classic effect in which a performer produces a dove from a seemingly empty pan.
words.name: Dove pan

words.def: Dovetail shuffle - see Riffle shuffle.
words.name: Dovetail shuffle

words.def: Downs Palm - to palm between the crotch of the index finger and the crotch of the thumb. Invented by T. Nelson Downs.
words.name: Downs Palm

words.def: Equivoque - a method of forcing a specific object on a spectator through a seemingly randomized selection process. See Force.
words.name: Equivoque

words.def: Effect - how a magic trick is perceived by a spectator.
words.name: Effect

words.def: Egg bag - a utility bag often made of black velvet which can be turned inside out to vanish an object (egg) or change one object for another.
words.name: Egg bag

words.def: Elmsley count - a false count (often done with four cards) where the surface of a card is hidden while the cards are passed from one hand to another. Named for Alex Elmsley, its inventor.
words.name: Elmsley count

words.def: Fairy dust - see Magic dust.
words.name: Fairy dust

words.def: False transfer - a technique in which an object appears to be taken into one hand while actually being retained in the other.
words.name: False transfer

words.def: False shuffle/False cut - a shuffle or cut in which the deck is apparently mixed but, in reality, the portions of the original order is retained such as a top or bottom stock kept in order - also see Blind Shuffle.
words.name: False shuffle/False cut

words.def: Faro - a shuffle similar to the riffle where the cards mesh perfectly. An in or out faro is performed depending on the position of the top card.
words.name: Faro

words.def: Finger Clip - a technique used to clip coins or small objects secretly. Usually used for production.
words.name: Finger Clip

words.def: Finger palm - to palm in the fingers.
words.name: Finger palm

words.def: Flash - to accidentally expose an object or part of an object momentarily during a secret move.
words.name: Flash

words.def: Flash Paper - a magic gimmick that allows the magician to create effect in a routine. Often used as misdirection. see Nitrocellulose.
words.name: Flash Paper

words.def: Flourish - a showy move which displays handling skills.
words.name: Flourish

words.def: French drop - A false transfer with a coin or small object.
words.name: French drop

words.def: Force - where a card or other object is made to be selected by the spectator, despite the appearance of a free choice.
words.name: Force

words.def: Gaff - A gimmick designed to look like something real while accomplishing some secret task.
words.name: Gaff

words.def: Ghost count - A false count of cards.
words.name: Ghost count

words.def: Glimpse - a secret view of a card or object.
words.name: Glimpse

words.def: Gimmick - a secret part or object used to make the trick work.
words.name: Gimmick

words.def: Invisible Deck - Classic effect by magician Don Alan in which a card merely named by the spectator is the only one face down in the face-up deck. Many magicians use the Invisible Deck as a backup plan if something goes wrong in the middle of a routine. Similar to a Brainwave Deck, in which a thought-of card is revealed face-up in a face-down deck--and has a different colored back.
words.name: Invisible Deck

words.def: Impromptu - a trick that can be performed at a moment's notice, usually with everyday objects and little or no preparation.
words.name: Impromptu

words.def: Key card - a known card used to locate another. See locator.
words.name: Key card

words.def: Lapping - dropping an object into one's lap to vanish it* performed while seated.
words.name: Lapping

words.def: Load - Verb--to secretly put an object into a location. Noun--An object in a secret location ready to be produced.
words.name: Load

words.def: Loaded - a die which comes up the same number, or an object which secretly contains another object ready for production.
words.name: Loaded

words.def: Locator - similar to a key card* a card which can be found in some way. It may be long, short, thick, rough, smooth, crimped, daubed, marked, reversed, or simply known.
words.name: Locator

words.def: Loop - A super-thin elastic string, tied into a small circular loop, worn on the wrist. Used for levitating small, lightweight objects and many PK effects.
words.name: Loop

words.def: M5 - Neodymium magnet, used for PK effects, balances, stopping watches, and vanishes.
words.name: M5

words.def: Magic dust - invisible substance stored in magician's pocket that supposedly makes tricks work. Excuse for going to a pocket to get rid of a vanished item. Also called "Woofle Dust." See Misdirection.
words.name: Magic dust

words.def: Magician's choice - see Force.
words.name: Magician's choice

words.def: Magician's rope - soft, usually white rope used for rope tricks.
words.name: Magician's rope

words.def: Magician's wax - wax used to temporarily attach objects. The earliest known magician's wax is beeswax.
words.name: Magician's wax

words.def: Manipulator - a magician with a showy sleight of hand act, often set to music.
words.name: Manipulator

words.def: Mark - a subject for a con game.
words.name: Mark

words.def: Mechanic - an operator who is very skilled at sleight of hand, usually with cards.
words.name: Mechanic

words.def: Mechanic's grip - a way of holding the pack in the left hand ready for dealing. The forefinger is on the front of the deck to help square the pack and control the cards. A lay person will hold the deck with the fingers all underneath or down the side.
words.name: Mechanic's grip

words.def: Mercury Fold - a card move in which the magician secretly folds a card under the deck.
words.name: Mercury Fold

words.def: Misdirection - psychological techniques for controlling attention.
words.name: Misdirection

words.def: Monte - a famous con game where three cards are thrown down and the mark has to follow a chosen card* due to a sleight of hand, the mark never wins.
words.name: Monte

words.def: One Ahead - principle often used in mentalism where the magician uses previously obtained information to stay one step ahead of the audience and supposedly make accurate predictions/guesses.
words.name: One Ahead

words.def: One-Handed Cut - a card flourish in which the magician cuts the deck using only one hand.
words.name: One-Handed Cut

words.def: Out - an alternative ending to an effect.
words.name: Out

words.def: Overhand shuffle - a shuffle where the cards are dropped from one hand into the other in small random groups.
words.name: Overhand shuffle

words.def: Packet trick - a card magic effect involving a small quantity of cards.
words.name: Packet trick

words.def: Palm - to secretly hold an object in the hand in a manner which is unnoticeable.
words.name: Palm

words.def: Pass - a secret move to transpose the halves of a pack* a way to secretly cut a deck of cards.
words.name: Pass

words.def: Patter - The dialogue used in the performance of an effect. Patter styles may differ from magicians to magicians - some prefer a serious patter, while others opt for a light hearted humorous patter to relax the audience and try to catch them off guard.
words.name: Patter

words.def: Peek - see Glimpse.
words.name: Peek

words.def: Profonde/Pochettes - large pockets in tail coats which can be used for vanishes or productions, although not a popular method today due to fashion trends.
words.name: Profonde/Pochettes

words.def: Pinch - holding something between the fingers.
words.name: Pinch

words.def: Plant - see Confederate.
words.name: Plant

words.def: PK Effect - see "Psychokinesis".
words.name: PK Effect

words.def: Psychokinesis - moving things using supposed supernatural powers.
words.name: Psychokinesis

words.def: Pull - a device of elastic which pulls object up sleeve or under jacket as in the vanishing cigarette.
words.name: Pull

words.def: Pull through shuffle - the concluding move to a riffle where the two halves are pulled through each other and not mixed.
words.name: Pull through shuffle

words.def: Retention of vision - the after-image on the retina* applied to certain visually convincing vanishes.
words.name: Retention of vision

words.def: Raven - a pull consisting of a padded magnet on elastic.
words.name: Raven

words.def: Riffle - to let cards come out of the hand, creating a noise.
words.name: Riffle

words.def: Riffle shuffle - the most common shuffling technique in which half of the deck is held in each hand with the thumbs inward, then cards are released by the thumbs so that they fall to the table intertwined.
words.name: Riffle shuffle

words.def: Rough - cards which have been treated with substance to increase surface friction, making it easier to keep cards aligned to each other.
words.name: Rough

words.def: Routine - a sequence of effects (typically related).
words.name: Routine

words.def: Run - taking the cards off singly during an overhand shuffle which can be used to stack the deck.
words.name: Run

words.def: Secret - core principle of conjuring; something which should not be shared, usually a method, sleight, or other means of accomplishing an effect.
words.name: Secret

words.def: Servante - a secret shelf or compartment behind the magician's table.
words.name: Servante

words.def: Silk - a silk handkerchief.
words.name: Silk

words.def: Shell - a hollowed out coin or ball which fits over the real object allowing vanish and reproductions.
words.name: Shell

words.def: Shell game - A confidence trick involving three half walnut shells and a pea. The mark bets on which shell contains the pea, but he loses every time because the operator is cheating with sleight of hand.
words.name: Shell game

words.def: Shill - see Confederate.
words.name: Shill

words.def: Shuffle - to randomize a deck of playing cards.
words.name: Shuffle

words.def: Siva Count - also known as the reversed elmsley count, is a false count done usually after executing an Elmsley count.
words.name: Siva Count

words.def: Sleeving - dropping an object up a sleeve to vanish it.
words.name: Sleeving

words.def: Sleeve Toss - a technique used in dove magic.
words.name: Sleeve Toss

words.def: Sleight - a secret move or technique.
words.name: Sleight

words.def: Slicks - highly polished cards or coins which are more slippery* useful for flourishes. See Rough.
words.name: Slicks

words.def: Slide - a tube used to get an object to an otherwise impossible to reach location.
words.name: Slide

words.def: Slip - to retain the top or bottom cards, or both, during an overhand shuffle.
words.name: Slip

words.def: Slip-on corner - a corner of a card that can be placed over the actual corner of a card. These corners show a rank and suit different from the card's actual.
words.name: Slip-on corner

words.def: Sphinx Principle - the concept that two mirrors at 90 degrees and with their apex facing the audience can be used to reflect the side curtains or walls, which are the same pattern as those at the back, enabling an object to be hidden behind the mirrors* first used in the Sphinx illusion.
words.name: Sphinx Principle

words.def: Sponge - a sponge ball.
words.name: Sponge

words.def: Spread - flourishing a deck of cards onto a tabletop.
words.name: Spread

words.def: Stack - a prearranged deck or part of the deck of cards, or to rearrange while overhand shuffling.
words.name: Stack

words.def: Steal - a sleight used to obtain an object secretly.
words.name: Steal

words.def: Stodare egg - a hollow egg used in vanish or production of a silk.
words.name: Stodare egg

words.def: Stooge - see Confederate.
words.name: Stooge

words.def: Sucker effect - a trick where the spectator is led to believe he has worked it out, only to be proven wrong.
words.name: Sucker effect

words.def: Switch - to exchange one object for another.
words.name: Switch

words.def: Table shuffle - a variation of the riffle shuffle, often used by dealers in casinos, in which the deck's halves are placed flat on the table with their rear corners touching. The back edges are then lifted with the thumbs while the halves are pushed together.
words.name: Table shuffle

words.def: Talking - inadvertent noises made by the props which can give away the trick.
words.name: Talking

words.def: Tenkai palm - to palm between the thumb and the palm.
words.name: Tenkai palm

words.def: Torn and Restored (also called TnR) - a trick in which the magician rips something up into many pieces and then "restores" it.
words.name: Torn and Restored (also called TnR)

words.def: Thumb palm - to palm in the crotch of the thumb.
words.name: Thumb palm

words.def: Thumb tip - A popular magician's prop consisting of a hollow plastic thumb that fits on the end of your thumb. Used to make small objects disappear and re-appear.
words.name: Thumb tip

words.def: Thumper - A device used by a magician to signal what their subject has selected so they (the magician) may tell them what to do with it, or what it is. Gives the audience the "illusion" that the magician has done magic on final reveal. Typically the "thumper" is triggered by an accomplice in the audience.
words.name: Thumper

words.def: Tourniquet - see French drop.
words.name: Tourniquet

words.def: Woofle dust - see Magic dust.
words.name: Woofle dust

words.def: wand - a stick commonly used by children's magicians to apparently make the trick work.It is usually black with white tips.
words.name: wand

words.def: Zarrow shuffle - A blind shuffle, that appears to be an honest riffle shuffle to spectators and leaves the deck entirely in its original order.
words.name: Zarrow shuffle

words.def: Zombie Ball - A ball that floats around, usually under the cover of a cloth.
words.name: Zombie Ball
